alert.note: Alert for Major; Woods; Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 21 at 10:06PM CDT until July 23 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Cimarron River near Waynoka affecting Major, Woodward and Woods Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Cimarron River near Waynoka. * WHEN...From this evening to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull conditions exist along the river... and some overflows may occur over some low-lying areas near the river. The river reach affected extends from near Freedom upstream... to the U.S. Highway 281 crossing south of Little Sahara State Park near Waynoka... to near Orienta in Major County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM CDT Friday the stage was 7.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will crest near 7.7 feet at 1 AM Saturday morning and hen fall to 7.0 feet Sunday morning. It will then rise to 7.4 feet Monday morning. It will fall to 7.3 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then rise to 7.4 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1015 AM CDT.
